record.title: ORDERS FOR THURSDAY, OCTOBER 18, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR THURSDAY, OCTOBER 18, 2007 -- (Senate - October 17, 2007)

[Page: S13027]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I appreciate everyone's patience. I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 9:30 a.m., Thursday, October 18; that on Thursday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day and that there then be a period for the transaction of morning business for 60 minutes, with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each and the time be equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees, with the Republicans controlling the first half and the Democrats the second half; that at the close of morning business, the Senate resume consideration of H.R. 3043, the Labor-HHS appropriations bill.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
